title: China’s Climate Change Strategy and U.S.- China Competition
description: Nikos Tsafos, James R. Schlesinger Chair for Energy and Geopolitics, testified before the U.S.-China Economic and Security Review Commission on the topic of "China’s Climate Change Strategy and U.S.-China Competition.”

title: Haiti’s Fractured Political Dynamics
description: Georges Fauriol analyzes Haiti's political landscape and what the current challenges mean for the country's prospects of democratic consolidation.

title: The Evening: Biden Details Aid, Fed Raises Rates, One More Saturday Night, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers the Biden Details Aid, Fed Raises Rates, One More Saturday Night, and More.

title: NATO on the Line: The Views of Four Former SACEURs
description: Four former supreme allied commanders of Europe join Dr. Seth G. Jones to discuss the implications of the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

title: Preparing for the Next Phase of the Russian War
description: The United States and its partners should prepare for the next phase of the Russian war in Ukraine and ultimately reduce Russia's advantages in future competition.

title: Russia Launches ‘Musical’ Space Salvo
description: Russia's space agency recently produced a satirical music video showing the Russian segment of the International Space Station decoupling itself from the station. So just how worried should NASA be?

title: A Principled and Implementable Path for American Assistance in Afghanistan
description: The United States should approach the worsening humanitarian conditions in Afghanistan with humanitarian-plus and market-based solutions that empower local NGOs, ensure human rights, and do not empower the Taliban government.

title: Aiding Ukraine: How the United States Can Give Ukrainians the Means to Fight
description: CSIS hosted a conversation with Rep. Michael McCaul (R-TX) on the important role that Congress plays in standing up to Russian aggression in Ukraine.

title: International Business and Russia: A New Cold War or a Temporary Pause?
description: The CSIS Scholl Chair in International Business looks at how the private sector has responded to the Russian invasion of Ukraine and possible scenarios for resuming business there.

title: The Evening: Kyiv Bombarded, Biden to Europe, Brokedown Palace, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers Kyiv Bombarded, Biden to Europe, Brokedown Palace, and More.

title: Cryptocurrency’s Role in the Russia-Ukraine Crisis
description: The CSIS Economics Program assesses whether crypto can be used to evade sanctions and shift funds in the context of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: The Case for Cooperation: The Future of the U.S.-UK Intelligence Alliance
description: Over the past 75 years, the United States and the United Kingdom have built the deepest intelligence alliance in the world. To prepare for the challenges of the future, the U.S. and UK intelligence communities must continue to pursue robust interoperability.
